item.description:
that pypi packages all have

  • RSS feeds of their release history
  • blake2b-256 hashes (but not blake3?)

That GitHub provides RSS feeds:

GitHub does offer built-in RSS feeds for certain activities, but they have key limitations:

  • Commits: Only available for a single branch (e.g., main). The URL format is https://github.com/{username}/{repo}/commits/{branch}.atom.
  • Releases, issues, and pull requests: These have dedicated RSS feeds (e.g., https://github.com/{username}/{repo}/releases.atom), but they donâ€™t include commit details.

– https://www.codestudy.net/blog/setting-up-a-github-commit-rss-feed/#understanding-githubs-native-rss-limitations
